abstract: The agency says Mohammed Mark Amin, a producer of such films as “Frida” and “Eve’s Bayou,” and several of his family members traded on insider tips he learned about DuPont Fabros Technology, a publicly held company that operates and manages data centers.
snippet: The agency says Mohammed Mark Amin, a producer of such films as “Frida” and “Eve’s Bayou,” and several of his family members traded on insider tips he learned about DuPont Fabros Technology, a publicly held company that operates and manages data c...
lead_paragraph: The Hollywood producer responsible for films like “Frida,” “Eve’s Bayou” and the horror series “Leprechaun” has agreed to settle charges of insider trading with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: Insider Trading Crackdown Ensnares Hollywood Producer
